summary: The Driver Reimbursement Increase for Veteran Equity Act of 2025 (DRIVE Act of 2025) aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code to improve veteran healthcare travel reimbursement. The bill mandates that the Department of Veterans Affairs increase mileage rates for beneficiary travel to match those for government employees on official business. It also sets a 90-day deadline for processing travel allowance payments. The core goal is to ensure equitable reimbursement for veterans traveling for healthcare.
